alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Osceola County through 215 PM EDT... At 142 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harmony, or near Holopaw, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Holopaw and Harmony. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
